column1: The following is a list of city government positions elected by city residents and the terms thereof:
Mayor: The mayor is the city's chief executive and is elected in odd-numbered years. The mayor receives compensation for his or her services.
Board of Aldermen: The Board of Aldermen consists of 15 members elected in odd-numbered years
column2: three from each of the city's five political districts. Per City Charter requirements
column3: only two of the three aldermen elected from each district may be from one political party to allow for minority representation on the board; voters are permitted to vote for any three aldermen in their district. Members of the Board of Aldermen receive no compensation for their services.

column1: Board of Education: The Board of Education deals with educational matters in the city and consists of 10 members elected in odd-numbered years
column2: two from each of the city's five political districts. Members receive no compensation for their services.

column1: Planning & Zoning Board: The Planning & Zoning Board deals with development and land use issues and consists of 10 members
column2: two from each of the city's five political districts. Members serve a four-year term
column3: with one of the two members of each political district up for election during each odd-numbered year's election cycle
column4: ensuring that no more than half of the board is made up of new members at the start of a new session. Members of the Planning & Zoning Board receive no compensation for their services.

column1: City Clerk: The city clerk is elected in odd-numbered years and receives a compensation for services provided.
Constables: Seven constables are elected in odd-numbered years
column2: though individual voters are only permitted to vote for any four of their choosing on the ballot. They are compensated on a case-by-case basis.
